thread.title: Beer Deliverymen Get Kidnapped and Executed by Mexican Cartel
thread.title_full: Beer Deliverymen Get Kidnapped and Executed by Mexican Cartel

author: Ben Marquis
title: Beer Deliverymen Get Kidnapped and Executed by Mexican Cartel
text:
El Chapo Extradited to U.S. for Trial Just Before Inauguration 
Three days later, their delivery truck was discovered in the town of General Bravo, with the bodies found along the side of the road connecting the two Mexican states. That area is known to be a clash point between rival factions and has seen the armed robbery and even kidnapping of tourists on buses traveling through. 
It was suspected that the deliverymen were robbed of the money they had collected during the deliveries, approximately 500,000 pesos, or nearly $25,000 U.S. dollars. It was unclear if there was any further motive other than robbery. 
In a follow-up post by Breitbart , it was reported that state authorities had arrested at least one man in connection with the murders. Advertisement â€“ story continues below 
The arrested man was identified as 36-year-old Ricardo Gonzalez Flores, and he was found near General Bravo. He is currently in custody and faces two homicide charges and one charge of robbery. Authorities say they are close to identifying a second gunman who was likely involved. 
The suspect is also being investigated for ties to other robberies in the area. 
This sort of horrific lawlessness is simply unacceptable in the U.S. and is precisely why there is such a clamor for a border wall and beefed-up security in the volatile region. Advertisement - story continues below
